channel.title: Client Base Finding/Item Into Wrong Equipement Position
channel.description:
Hey, I need some help finding which client base I'm on... :(
Hey,
So I have added a couple of things to my server. I do the add models, all that, everything seems to work fine and dandy. I click on them in my inventory, (Bandos platelegs), and instead of them going onto my (obviously) legs, they go into my hand, and glitch on top of whatever I'm wearing in my legs slot currently.
Info: 317. Not sure what base exactly.
help please?
THANKS!!!
SGT
Is it client side? Server side? Also, once I assign it to a proper item slot, will it show properly (Like actually in hand instead of over it?)

item.title: Client Base Finding/Item Into Wrong Equipement Position
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

yeah do add it to the item.cfg if it is not listed in there. it will show up as non existant item (itemid)!!! sometyhin like that. and only being worth 1gp. lol

Read full topic
item.source: Client Base Finding/Item Into Wrong Equipement Position

item.title: Client Base Finding/Item Into Wrong Equipement Position
item.dc:creator: @SGTCannon SGTCannon
item.description:
@SGTCannon wrote:

Thank you so much.
What do I do if the item isn’t listed? Do I create it there myself? (And in item.cfg i guess?)

Read full topic
item.source: Client Base Finding/Item Into Wrong Equipement Position

item.title: Client Base Finding/Item Into Wrong Equipement Position
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It is server sided. and depending on what base you have. It might be in the Item.java Item1.java or the 2 preceding that. just open it and if there is a bunch of codes with item id’s in there and they are lists and have the start saying like helmet, Platelegs, Etc. you found the right one. just and the Id of the platelegs to the correct spot then compile and restart

Read full topic
item.source: Client Base Finding/Item Into Wrong Equipement Position
